game

Class ShootingAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Action
      • game.ShootingAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.monash.fit2099.interfaces.ActionInterface

    public class ShootingAction
extends edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Action
    A class which represents shooting action which allows player to choose shooting direction from a sub menu and results in area effect damage to more than one target based on specific miss chance.
    Author:
    Tan Wei Li

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static int SHOOTING_MISS_CHANCE
      a constant integer of 25 which represents the miss chance of shooting action
      private edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Exit shootingDirection
      an Exit object used to represent direction of shooting action
      private LongRangedWeapon shotgun
      a LongRangedWeapon object used in shooting action

    • Method Detail

      • getAffectedDirections

        private java.util.List<edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Exit> getAffectedDirections(java.util.List<edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Exit> allPossibleDirection,
                                                                             edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Exit direction)
        Get the directions that will form the area affected by the shooting action based on the shooter current locations and the shooting direction chosen.
        Parameters:
        allPossibleDirection - list of directions possible from shooter's location
        direction - shooting direction chosen by player
        Returns:
        a list of directions Exits object which represents the directions that will form the area affected by the shooting action. (eg: if player chose to shoot in North and if the current exits from the player location include North, North West and North East, this method will return a list of Exits which include these 3 exits. Else if the current exits from the player location do not include North East, this method will return a list of Exits which include North and North West only.)

      • getAffectedArea

        private java.util.List<edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Location> getAffectedArea(java.util.List<edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Exit> affectedDirection,
                                                                           edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Exit mainDirection,
                                                                           edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Location actorLocation)
        Get the areas affected by the shooting action performed by shooter in specific direction.
        Parameters:
        affectedDirection - List of directions affected by shooting action
        mainDirection - The direction of shooting chosen by shooter
        actorLocation - The shooter current location
        Returns:
        a list of locations which represents the area being affected by the shooting action.

      • getBranchInDirectionOf

        private java.util.List<edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Location> getBranchInDirectionOf(edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Location startLocation,
                                                                                  edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Exit direction,
                                                                                  int length)
        Get a path of specific length in specific direction starting from the location given (excluded start location).
        Parameters:
        startLocation - location to start building path from
        direction - direction to extend the path from start location
        length - length of path
        Returns:
        a list of location which represents the path of specific length in specific direction starting from the location given (excluded start location).

      • getLocationInDirectionOf

        private edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Location getLocationInDirectionOf(edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Location location,
                                                                    edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Exit direction)
        Get a location in the specific direction from the location given.
        Parameters:
        location - location used to get another location
        direction - direction used to find another location
        Returns:
        a location in the specific direction from the location given if there is any, else return null

      • execute

        public java.lang.String execute(edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor actor,
                                edu.monash.fit2099.engine.GameMap map)
                         throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Perform the shooting action. If the player choose to shoot, a sub menu will be displayed to allow Player to choose shooting direction, and all actors in the affected area of the shooting action will have chance to be attacked. Each time shooting, a bullet in the shotgun will be used up.
        Specified by:
        execute in class edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Action
        Parameters:
        actor - The actor performing the action.
        map - The map the actor is on.
        Returns:
        A suitable description to display in the UI
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if actor or map argument is null
        See Also:
        Action.execute(Actor, GameMap)

      • menuDescription

        public java.lang.String menuDescription(edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor actor)
                                 throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Show general description of shooting action if the shooting direction is not yet chosen, else also include the shooting direction in description.
        Specified by:
        menuDescription in class edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Action
        Parameters:
        actor - The actor performing the action.
        Returns:
        A string, e.g. "Player shoots in the direction of North"
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if actor is null
        See Also:
        Action.menuDescription(Actor)
